intro: Taraxacum informe, commonly known as the slender dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy white seeds with parachute-like structures for wind dispersal. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Taraxacum informe is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
